trans-unit.source: Get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking (Azure portal)
trans-unit.target: Get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking (Azure portal)

trans-unit.source: How to get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: How to get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking (Azure portal)
trans-unit.target: Get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking (Azure portal)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Dynamic Data Masking - Azure Preview portal
trans-unit.target: Dynamic Data Masking - Azure Preview portal

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking limits sensitive data exposure by masking it to non-privileged users.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking limits sensitive data exposure by masking it to non-privileged users.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic data masking is in preview for Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers in the V12 version of Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic data masking is in preview for Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers in the V12 version of Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic data masking helps prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data by enabling customers to designate how much of the sensitive data to reveal with minimal impact on the application layer.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic data masking helps prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data by enabling customers to designate how much of the sensitive data to reveal with minimal impact on the application layer.

trans-unit.source: It’s a policy-based security feature that hides the sensitive data in the result set of a query over designated database fields, while the data in the database is not changed.
trans-unit.target: It’s a policy-based security feature that hides the sensitive data in the result set of a query over designated database fields, while the data in the database is not changed.

trans-unit.source: For example, a call center support person may identify callers by several digits of their social security number or credit card number, but those data items should not be fully exposed to the support person.
trans-unit.target: For example, a call center support person may identify callers by several digits of their social security number or credit card number, but those data items should not be fully exposed to the support person.

trans-unit.source: A developer can define a masking rule to be applied to each query result that masks all but the last four digits of any social security number or credit card number in the result set.
trans-unit.target: A developer can define a masking rule to be applied to each query result that masks all but the last four digits of any social security number or credit card number in the result set.

trans-unit.source: For another example, by using the appropriate data mask to protect personally identifiable information (PII) data, a developer can query production environments for troubleshooting purposes without violating compliance regulations.
trans-unit.target: For another example, by using the appropriate data mask to protect personally identifiable information (PII) data, a developer can query production environments for troubleshooting purposes without violating compliance regulations.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking basics
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking basics

trans-unit.source: You set up dynamic data masking policy in the Azure portal under the Auditing & Security tab for your database.
trans-unit.target: You set up dynamic data masking policy in the Azure portal under the Auditing & Security tab for your database.

trans-unit.source: Before setting up dynamic data masking check if you are using a ["Downlevel Client"](sql-database-auditing-and-dynamic-data-masking-downlevel-clients.md).
trans-unit.target: Before setting up dynamic data masking check if you are using a ["Downlevel Client"](sql-database-auditing-and-dynamic-data-masking-downlevel-clients.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To set up dynamic data masking in the Azure Preview portal, see [Get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking (Azure Preview portal)](sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To set up dynamic data masking in the Azure Preview portal, see [Get started with SQL Database Dynamic Data Masking (Azure Preview portal)](sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Dynamic data masking permissions
trans-unit.target: Dynamic data masking permissions

trans-unit.source: Dynamic data masking can be configured by the Azure Database admin, server admin, or security officer roles.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic data masking can be configured by the Azure Database admin, server admin, or security officer roles.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic data masking policy
trans-unit.target: Dynamic data masking policy

trans-unit.source: **Privileged logins** - A set of logins that will get unmasked data in the SQL query results.
trans-unit.target: **Privileged logins** - A set of logins that will get unmasked data in the SQL query results.

trans-unit.source: **Masking rules** - A set of rules that define the designated fields to be masked and the masking function that will be used.
trans-unit.target: **Masking rules** - A set of rules that define the designated fields to be masked and the masking function that will be used.

trans-unit.source: The designated fields can be defined using a database table name and column name.
trans-unit.target: The designated fields can be defined using a database table name and column name.

trans-unit.source: **Masking functions** - A set of methods that control the exposure of data for different scenarios.
trans-unit.target: **Masking functions** - A set of methods that control the exposure of data for different scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Masking Function
trans-unit.target: Masking Function

trans-unit.source: Masking Logic
trans-unit.target: Masking Logic

trans-unit.source: Default
trans-unit.target: Default

trans-unit.source: **Full masking according to the data types of the designated fields**
trans-unit.target: **Full masking according to the data types of the designated fields**

trans-unit.source: • Use XXXXXXXX or fewer Xs if the size of the field is less than 8 characters for string data types (nchar, ntext, nvarchar).
trans-unit.target: • Use XXXXXXXX or fewer Xs if the size of the field is less than 8 characters for string data types (nchar, ntext, nvarchar).

trans-unit.source: • Use a zero value for numeric data types (bigint, bit, decimal, int, money, numeric, smallint, smallmoney, tinyint, float, real).
trans-unit.target: • Use a zero value for numeric data types (bigint, bit, decimal, int, money, numeric, smallint, smallmoney, tinyint, float, real).

trans-unit.source: • Use 01-01-1900 for date/time data types (date, datetime2, datetime, datetimeoffset, smalldatetime, time).
trans-unit.target: • Use 01-01-1900 for date/time data types (date, datetime2, datetime, datetimeoffset, smalldatetime, time).

trans-unit.source: • For SQL variant, the default value of the current type is used.
trans-unit.target: • For SQL variant, the default value of the current type is used.

trans-unit.source: • For XML the document
trans-unit.target: • For XML the document

trans-unit.source: is used.
trans-unit.target: is used.

trans-unit.source: • Use an empty value for special data types (timestamp table, hierarchyid, GUID, binary, image, varbinary spatial types).
trans-unit.target: • Use an empty value for special data types (timestamp table, hierarchyid, GUID, binary, image, varbinary spatial types).

trans-unit.source: Credit card
trans-unit.target: Credit card

trans-unit.source: **Masking method which exposes the last four digits of the designated fields** and adds a constant string as a prefix in the form of a credit card.
trans-unit.target: **Masking method which exposes the last four digits of the designated fields** and adds a constant string as a prefix in the form of a credit card.

trans-unit.source: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-1234
trans-unit.target: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-1234

trans-unit.source: Social security number
trans-unit.target: Social security number

trans-unit.source: **Masking method which exposes the last two digits of the designated fields** and adds a constant string as a prefix in the form of an American social security number.
trans-unit.target: **Masking method which exposes the last two digits of the designated fields** and adds a constant string as a prefix in the form of an American social security number.

trans-unit.source: XXX-XX-XX12
trans-unit.target: XXX-XX-XX12

trans-unit.source: Email
trans-unit.target: Email

trans-unit.source: **Masking method which exposes the first letter and replaces the domain with XXX.com** using a constant string prefix in the form of an email address.
trans-unit.target: **Masking method which exposes the first letter and replaces the domain with XXX.com** using a constant string prefix in the form of an email address.

trans-unit.source: aXX@XXXX.com
trans-unit.target: aXX@XXXX.com

trans-unit.source: Random number
trans-unit.target: Random number

trans-unit.source: **Masking method which generates a random number** according to the selected boundaries and actual data types.
trans-unit.target: **Masking method which generates a random number** according to the selected boundaries and actual data types.

trans-unit.source: If the designated boundaries are equal, then the masking function will be a constant number.
trans-unit.target: If the designated boundaries are equal, then the masking function will be a constant number.

trans-unit.source: ![Navigation pane](./media/sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started-portal/1_DDM_Random_number.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Navigation pane](./media/sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started-portal/1_DDM_Random_number.png)

trans-unit.source: Custom text
trans-unit.target: Custom text

trans-unit.source: **Masking method which exposes the first and last characters** and adds a custom padding string in the middle.
trans-unit.target: **Masking method which exposes the first and last characters** and adds a custom padding string in the middle.

trans-unit.source: prefix[padding]suffix
trans-unit.target: prefix[padding]suffix

trans-unit.source: ![Navigation pane](./media/sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started-portal/2_DDM_Custom_text.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Navigation pane](./media/sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started-portal/2_DDM_Custom_text.png)

trans-unit.source: Security-enabled connection string
trans-unit.target: Security-enabled connection string

trans-unit.source: If you are using a ["Downlevel Client"](sql-database-auditing-and-dynamic-data-masking-downlevel-clients.md), then you must update existing clients (example: applications) to use a modified connection string format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a ["Downlevel Client"](sql-database-auditing-and-dynamic-data-masking-downlevel-clients.md), then you must update existing clients (example: applications) to use a modified connection string format.

trans-unit.source: Please click [here](sql-database-auditing-and-dynamic-data-masking-downlevel-clients.md) for details.
trans-unit.target: Please click [here](sql-database-auditing-and-dynamic-data-masking-downlevel-clients.md) for details.

trans-unit.source: Set up dynamic data masking for your database using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Set up dynamic data masking for your database using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Launch the Azure portal at [https://manage.windowsazure.com](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Launch the Azure portal at [https://manage.windowsazure.com](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Click the database you want to mask, and then click the **AUDITING & SECURITY** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the database you want to mask, and then click the **AUDITING & SECURITY** tab.

trans-unit.source: Under **dynamic data masking**, click **ENABLED** to enable the dynamic data masking feature.
trans-unit.target: Under **dynamic data masking**, click **ENABLED** to enable the dynamic data masking feature.

trans-unit.source: Type the privileged logins that should have access to the unmasked sensitive data.
trans-unit.target: Type the privileged logins that should have access to the unmasked sensitive data.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] To make it so the application layer can display sensitive data for application privileged users, add the SQL login that is being used to query the database.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] To make it so the application layer can display sensitive data for application privileged users, add the SQL login that is being used to query the database.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended that this list contain a minimal number of logins to minimize exposure of the sensitive data.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended that this list contain a minimal number of logins to minimize exposure of the sensitive data.

trans-unit.source: Navigation pane
trans-unit.target: Navigation pane

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page in the menu bar, click **Add MASK** to open the masking rule configuration window.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page in the menu bar, click **Add MASK** to open the masking rule configuration window.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Table** and **Column** from the dropdown lists to define the designated fields that will be masked.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Table** and **Column** from the dropdown lists to define the designated fields that will be masked.

trans-unit.source: Choose a **MASKING FUNCTION** from the list of sensitive data masking categories.
trans-unit.target: Choose a **MASKING FUNCTION** from the list of sensitive data masking categories.

trans-unit.source: Navigation pane
trans-unit.target: Navigation pane

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** in the data masking rule window to update the set of masking rules in the dynamic data masking policy.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** in the data masking rule window to update the set of masking rules in the dynamic data masking policy.

trans-unit.source: Click **SAVE** to save the new or updated masking policy.
trans-unit.target: Click **SAVE** to save the new or updated masking policy.

trans-unit.source: Set up dynamic data masking for your database using Powershell cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Set up dynamic data masking for your database using Powershell cmdlets

trans-unit.source: See [Azure SQL Database Cmdlets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt163521.aspx).
trans-unit.target: See [Azure SQL Database Cmdlets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt163521.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Set up dynamic data masking for your database using REST API
trans-unit.target: Set up dynamic data masking for your database using REST API

trans-unit.source: See [Operations for Azure SQL Databases](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn505719.aspx).
trans-unit.target: See [Operations for Azure SQL Databases](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn505719.aspx).
